courses.title: Elementary Russian I
courses.description: Introduction to listening, speaking, reading, and writing in Russian and to the culture of Russian-speaking regions.

courses.title: Elementary Russian II
courses.description: Continued listening, speaking, reading, and writing in Russian with further study of the culture of Russian-speaking regions.

courses.title: Vampires and Memory of Stalinism in Post-Soviet Russia
courses.description: Gothic aesthetics in post-Soviet Russian and U.S. vampire fiction and films.  Post-Soviet fiction and movies as a source for studying historical memory.  Conducted in English.

courses.title: Intensive Elementary Russian II
courses.description: Continues introduction to fundamental Russian grammar and development of four modalities -- speaking, reading, listening, and writing -- in intensive immersion environment in Russia.  Credit not allowed for both RUSS 1692 and RUSS 1002.

courses.title: Intermediate Russian I
courses.description: A rapid review of grammar with continued use of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in Russian, all with a cultural emphasis.

courses.title: Intermediate Russian II
courses.description: This course focuses on listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in Russian in an introduction to literature and within a cultural context.

courses.title: Intensive Intermediate Russian I
courses.description: Review and extension of basic grammar, intensive vocabulary- building, and development of idiom on the basis of conversation, reading, and writing activities (in Russia). Credit not allowed for both RUSS 2691 and RUSS 2001.

courses.title: Intensive Intermediate Russian II
courses.description: Review and extension of basic grammar, intensive vocabulary- building, and development of idiom on the basis of conversation, reading, and writing activities (in Russia).  Credit not allowed for both RUSS 2692 and RUSS 2002.

courses.title: Advanced Russian I
courses.description: First half of advanced courses in Russian conversation and composition. Discussion of controversial issues with the goal of self-expression in coherent paragraphs. Advanced grammar topics.

courses.title: Advanced Russian II
courses.description: Second half of advanced courses in Russian conversation and composition. Discussion of controversial issues with the goal of self-expression in coherent paragraphs. Advanced grammar topics.

courses.title: Russian for Heritage Speakers
courses.description: Russian-language communication skills for heritage speakers. Focus on grammar and orthography, stylistics of adult/professional communication. Reading, discussion and writing on contemporary topics. Taught in Russian. Credit will not be awarded for both RUSS 3005 and RUSS 3001.

courses.title: The Russian Twentieth Century in Literature and Film
courses.description: Russian twentieth-century literature and film. Discussion of historical and cultural context, aesthetics, structure and meaning. Reading and discussion in English.

courses.title: Urban Mythologies in Russian Literature
courses.description: Students analyze iconic texts that have been shaped by both Russian and non-Russian urban environments across generations. Conducted in English.

courses.title: Russian and American Mass Cultures
courses.description: Trends, genres and youth movements existing in contemporary American and Russian mass culture area compared to distinguish important cultural differences and similarities. Conducted in English.

courses.title: Intensive Advanced Russian
courses.description: Intensive development of aural/oral communication skills, capitalizing on a rich linguistic environment. Review and expansion of grammar, practiced in context. Focus on description, narration and comparison.

courses.title: Advanced Reading and Composition for Business, Science and Technology
courses.description: Advanced reading and writing skills. Study of syntax enables more sophisticated paragraph structure. Readings include newspaper texts on current affairs, business, science and technology.

courses.title: Contemporary Russia
courses.description: General introduction to political, cultural, social, and historical background of Russian domestic and foreign politics.  Lectures in English.  Discussion section and research project in Russian.

courses.title: Imperial Imagination Through Literature and Film
courses.description: This course examines how Russian, Soviet, and post-Soviet culture constructed the representations of the parts of the former Russian/Soviet empire. Taught in Russian.

courses.title: Nineteenth-Century Russian Writers
courses.description: Trends and paradigms in Russian literature from Pushkin to Chekhov. Conducted in Russian.

courses.title: Technology, Society, and Culture in the Soviet Union and Russia
courses.description: Problems of sustainability, ecology, medicine, industrial development, and technological progress as manifested in Soviet and Russian society and reflected in culture. Conducted in Russian.

courses.title: Invention of Business Discourse in Russia (1990-)
courses.description: Origins of business discourse in post-Soviet Russia.  Transformations in meaning of words and related practices during process of acculturation.  Conducted in Russian.

courses.title: Russian Culture through the Prism of Song
courses.description: Russian songs as object of study and focal points for broader exploration of key issues in Russian and Soviet culture and history.  Conducted in Russian.

courses.title: Russian Intercultural Capstone Seminar
courses.description: Russia and the West: cultural models and political fault lines.  Historical debates that continue to divide and engage Russians.  Conducted in Russian.

courses.title: Intensive Advanced Russian II
courses.description: Russian LBAT summer program. Reading on and discussion of contemporary Russian and global issues. Advanced grammar and syntax. Stylistics of written discourses. Taught in Russian.
